bwwExcerpt: Ownership and changing fortunes are at the heart of this mystery play. It's the most engrossing to date from a writer whose work ('Take Me Out' is the best known) I usually find too self-consciously clever to be taken seriously...Nothing and everything happens in this Manhattan Theatre Club production. The strength of 'The Assembled Parties,' staged by artistic director Lynne Meadow with a fluidly involving intimacy, is the way family secrets insinuate themselves into the fabric even of lives lived independently. They penetrate the walls and overlap, and they always have unforeseen consequences.
